description.raw:
I noticed that it wasn't possible to run test coverage for SDF. Running this:

`cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage`

Would give this error:

~~~
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:132 (include):
  include could not find load file:

    /home/louise/code/sdformat/cmake/CodeCoverage.cmake
~~~

So I copied `CodeCoverage.cmake` from ignition math here, and was able to build coverage.

### Coverage

1. Install lcov: `sudo apt-get install lcov`

1. `cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=coverage ../; make`

1. run tests (`make test`, or individual tests)

1. `make coverage`

1. `firefox coverage/index.html`

You'll see a really red report like this:

![lcovsdf.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/3595241416-lcovsdf.png)


### Exception copy constructor to fix test segfault

For some reason, `UNIT_Exception_TEST` fails with a segfault on `~Exception` when trying to `delete this->dataPtr`, but only when running test coverage, so it is [not failing on Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/sdformat-ci-sdformat4-xenial-amd64/6/consoleFull).

After some investigation I noticed there were two calls to the destructor. [This](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30309038/why-is-the-destructor-of-an-exception-called-twice) gave the idea of adding a copy constructor, and it turns out that fixed the problem for me.
